article_title: Book Review: 'American Mirror' by Deborah Solomon
article_text:
In anticipation of Thanksgiving, every American who cherishes the traditions that make this country great should acquire a copy of "American Mirror," Deborah Solomon's brilliantly insightful chronicle of the life of illustrator Norman Rockwell.

Working primarily for mass-market magazines—a source of entertainment and information as significant then as television and the Internet are now—Rockwell (1894-1978) turned out hundreds of prodigiously detailed, endlessly ingenious genre scenes, each one a self-contained...
